page.title: 13WILLOUGHBY CHURCH
page.content: The church in Willoughby started in the 13th century.Before Mr Bookless the present vicar there have been 40 other vicars.There has been quite a lot changed and added in the church.The aisles have been partially rebuilt and there have been some choir stalls added and a chantry chapel built by the Willoughby family.Before the organ was installed,there was a coke-burning stove there and music was provided by a harmonium.The organ has recently been moved from the chancel to the nave and thoroughly repaired .This is due to dampness on the walls of the church.The clock was put in the tower as a memorial to mark the end of the First World War,paid for by the village people. There are 6 bells in the tower which are rung regularly for services.
